content: * *This article has multiple issues.** Please help **improve it** or discuss these issues on the **talk page**. *(Learn how and when to remove these messages)*This article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "1997 Singapore League Cup" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(April 2023)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)*This article includes a list of references, related reading, or external links, **but its sources remain unclear because it lacks inline citations**. Please help improve this article by introducing more precise citations. *(April 2023)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)*Football tournament season The 1997 edition of the **Singapore League Cup** was a football tournament involving the teams in the [S.League](/wiki/S.League). It was renamed the [Singapore Cup](/wiki/Singapore_Cup) in 1998. The [Singapore League Cup](/wiki/Singapore_League_Cup) launched in 2007 is a different competition. This first edition of the competition would feature nine teams drawn into three groups of three teams, playing on a home and away basis. The group winners and best runner-up would qualify for the semi-finals. [SAFFC](/wiki/Singapore_Armed_Forces_Football_Club) would win the championship defeating [Geylang United](/wiki/Geylang_United) 1:0 in the final. ## Teams - [Balestier Central](/wiki/Balestier_Khalsa_FC) - [Geylang United](/wiki/Geylang_United_FC) - [Home United](/wiki/Home_United_FC) - [Jurong](/wiki/Jurong_FC) - [Sembawang Rangers](/wiki/Sembawang_Rangers_FC) - [Singapore Armed Forces FC (SAFFC)](/wiki/Singapore_Armed_Forces_Football_Club) - [Tampines Rovers](/wiki/Tampines_Rovers_FC) - [Tiong Bahru United](/wiki/Tanjong_Pagar_United_FC) - [Woodlands Wellington](/wiki/Woodlands_Wellington_FC) ## Semi-finals ### First leg 16 August 199719:45[SAFFC](/wiki/Singapore_Armed_Forces_Football_Club)1 – 0[Tampines Rovers](/wiki/Tampines_Rovers_FC)17 August 199719:45[Tiong Bahru United](/wiki/Tanjong_Pagar_United_FC)3 – 1[Geylang United](/wiki/Geylang_United_FC) ### Second leg 19 August 199719:45[Tampines Rovers](/wiki/Tampines_Rovers_FC)1 – 1[SAFFC](/wiki/Singapore_Armed_Forces_Football_Club)20 August 199719:45[Geylang United](/wiki/Geylang_United_FC)3 – 1[Tiong Bahru United](/wiki/Tanjong_Pagar_United_FC)[Penalties](/wiki/Penalty_shoot-out_(association_football))3 – 2 ## Final 6 September 199719:45[SAFFC](/wiki/Singapore_Armed_Forces_Football_Club)1 – 0[Geylang United](/wiki/Geylang_United_FC)Mioc 78' - Official S.League website - Football Association of Singapore website This article about a Singaporean football competition is a stub. title: 1997 Singapore League Cup
